subject: Misunderstanding the use of the Assume Class
msgSnippet: Hi, I want to use the Assume class to dynamically turn off some tests. There are tests I want run when we run full regression but not at other times. I have
messageBody:
Hi,
I want to use the Assume class to dynamically turn off some tests. There are tests I want run when we run full regression but not at other times. I have implemented an assume line that I thought would ignore the test as follows
String buildType = System.getenv(BUILD_TYPE);
Assume.assumeNotNull(buildType);
Assume.assumeTrue(buildType.equals(DAILY_BUILD));

The test runs and exits when it reaches the assumeNotNull as I expected. However when all my tests finish I get an error in the junit report
build.xml:1100: JunitTests failed. Check "C:\DEV\junitreport

Inside of the report I have the following

<error message="got: <[null]>, expected: each not null" type="org.junit.internal.AssumptionViolatedException"> at com.MyCode.InclusionFileProcessTest.testLoadLargeListbyId(InclusionFileProcessTest.java:352)
</error>

To me ignoring the test would mean just that, nothing happens. Am I doing something wrong? I have recently upgraded from junit 3.x to 4.x have I missed something in the upgrade?
